questions.header: What are the standard support hours for ADC Services?
questions.description: The standard support hours are Monday – Friday, 9am – 5:30pm, however support is often available Monday – Friday 8am – 6pm. Support outside of these hours is negotiable on a project basis.

questions.header: Is there a Service Level Agreement (SLA) for ADC Services?
questions.description: Yes, please find the SLA document attached.

questions.header: Who do I contact for general enquiries, support or escalations?
questions.description: You can contact the ADC team at adcuk@capgemini.co.uk

questions.header: How do I order ADC Services?
questions.description: You can order all ADC Services through the ADC UK Portal Catalogue.
Please see the attached security policy. Project specific security is negotiable upon project inception.

questions.header: How and where can I access ADC Services?
questions.description: All our services are publicly accessible internationally. ADC services can be accessed through the following links: Services: ADC Jira, ADC Confluence, Bitbucket, Joyent Confluence, Joyent Jira, Crowd, Stash. ADC Remote Access via Pulse Secure: Woking Access Merlin Access

questions.header: Where are the ADC Services delivered from?
questions.description: The majority of our services are delivered from a private cloud on our Merlin Datacentre located in Swindon, UK, some services are hosted with Joyent. Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS) are delivered using Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services and IBM Bluemix.

questions.header: Are there any planned maintenance periods for ADC Services?
questions.description: All maintenance timings can be agreed upon project inception based on convenience for delivery.
Yes, your services are backed up. Specific backup protocols can be agreed upon project inception.
